name: hexafluorobenzene
Reason: 1,6-Difluorohexane has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. Fluorine substituents significantly increase the melting point due to strong electronegativity which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each fluorine is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 15 degrees Celsius, giving a total increase of (15 degrees Celsius x 6 fluorines) = 90 degrees Celsius.
